title: Allium sativum
Vernacular name: English- Garlic </br> Hindi- Lahasun </br> Gujarati- Lasan </br> Sanskrit- Rasona </br>
Chemical Constituents: Volatile Oil containing Allyl Disulphide and Diallyl Disulphide. It also contains Allin, Allicin, Mucilage and Albumin.
Therapeutic uses: Used as an aphrodisiac as well as for colds, coughs, high blood pressure, diarrhea, rheumatism, snake bites, and as an antiseptic.
